meanings.definition: A person who shouts support for a team or player at a sporting event.
meanings.sent1: The barrackers cheered loudly for their team during the match.
meanings.sent2: The group of barrackers at the stadium motivated the players with their shouts.
meanings.sent3: The barrackers were so enthusiastic that they even inspired the referee to smile.
meanings.sent4: The barrackers' voices were like a symphony of encouragement echoing through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The image of the barrackers waving flags and chanting will stay with me forever.

meanings.definition: To shout support for a team or player at a sporting event.
meanings.sent1: Fans barrackers loudly to show their support for the team.
meanings.sent2: She barrackers passionately whenever her favorite player is on the field.
meanings.sent3: The crowd barrackers so energetically that even the birds outside seemed interested.
meanings.sent4: His voice barrackers above all others, pushing the team forward with his enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The way she barrackers makes you feel like you're part of something bigger.
